content: them on the inside of the stocking & having to flip it inside out afterall this pattern is simply a guide let your imagination & creativity take you where it may ©ashleymaglich ©ashleymaglich insert your hook into the first stitch at the top of the stocking pull your yarn through ch1 & single_crochet back into that same stitch note just do your best to judge where to put the stitches for the first 8 row because you are going to be making stitches into the sides of the double_crochet stitches that you made so there isn t technically a stitch to go into until after the 8 row ©ashleymaglich you are going to make a single_crochet in every stitch around starting from the top of the stocking down to where the heel starts ©ashleymaglich in the last stitch down you are going to make 4 single_crochet in that same stitch this is to give the heel some curve to it ©ashleymaglich you will now continue to make a single_crochet in each stitch down on the last single_crochet ch1 & fo *the picture below is how it would look if you did your single_crochet stitches on the right side of the stocking like i mentioned earlier whatever way you prefer i like them both ©ashleymaglich once that is done i personally like to sew in all my loose ends at this point because the next step is to turn your work back right side out if that s the route you decided to go *the picture below is the stocking turned right side so you can see the difference ©ashleymaglich top border of the stocking in between the granny clusters you are going to make 1/2 double_crochet 2dc 1/2 double_crochet all in that same space then you will single_crochet in the middle stitch of the next 3dc cluster i like to flip my stocking with the l shape facing the opposite way with the toe pointing to the left ©ashleymaglich insert your hook into the middle stitch of the first 3dc ch1 & single_crochet back into that same stitch in the space between the 3dc clusters you will make 1/2dc 2dc 1/2dc in the same space then single_crochet in the middle of the 3dc repeat this all the way around ©ashleymaglich you will have to make a cluster in the back of the stocking check the next photo for reference *you are going to make your last 1/2dc 2dc 1/2dc cluster in the same stitch as the first single_crochet where you stitched your stocking together slip_stitch into the first single_crochet ch1 & fo ©ashleymaglich the toe you will be attaching your yarn in the middle double_crochet of the 3dc cluster of the toe as shown in photo below ©ashleymaglich round 1 ch1 single_crochet in that same stitch single_crochet in the next stitch skip the next stitch & repeat all the way around single_crochet next 2 stitches skip the next when you have 24 stitches you will now be at the bottom
